intro: Planchonella baillonii, commonly known as the Bailloni's pomegranate, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may turn reddish in some cases. It is often found in dry forests and is adapted to arid conditions. The plant has limited commercial use but is of interest for its ecological role in its native habitat.
